title: Forest teams monitor movement of elephants in Vellore
content: The drive comes in the wake of a herd of elephants reportedly destroying large tracts of farmlands in areas like Rajiv Gandhi Nagar and Indira Nagar near Panamadangi RF for the past few days

title: Majnu Komath, architect of struggle for Goshree Bridges, passes away
content: He served as chairman of the Ernakulam-Vypeen Bridges Action Council, formed in the 1980s, and remained steadfast in the struggle until the bridges became a reality in 2004

title: Congress does not believe in ‘backdoor politics’, says Selvaperunthagai
content: Clarifying the party’s position on alliances, he says seat-sharing talks in Tamil Nadu are being handled by a committee appointed by the party high command and led by Girish Chodankar

title: Anbumani urges T.N. government to hold talks with Livelihood Mission workers, fill headmaster vacancies
content: The PMK leader says the workers’ repeated demands for salary revision and service regularisation have been ignored, forcing them to launch a sit-in protest

title: Stalin urges Modi to consult States before finalising caste enumeration rules for Census
content: Caste enumeration is a sensitive matter that touches upon deep-rooted social dynamics and has the potential to cause unintended societal tensions if not handled with utmost care, says T.N. Chief Minister

title: Set aside political differences for development of capital city: Governor
content: Meeting with Thiruvananthapuram Corporation councillors, Rajendra Arlekar underscores the importance of dedication and efficient implementation for development

title: Avakai–Amaravati festival concludes on grand note in Vijayawada
content: Three-day celebration of cinema, culture and literature draws over 7,000 visitors on final day; next edition set for December 2026

title: Students shocked over closing of Vaishno Devi medical college in Jammu over ‘poor infrastructure’
content: The Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Medical College, one of the ambitious projects of J&K, registered its first batch on the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) ranking in October-November 2024; out of 50 MBBS seats, 42 Muslim students, mostly from Kashmir, qualified for the college

title: Centre to focus on 100 high-risk districts to cut road accident deaths
content: Zero-fatalities programme has already been rolled out in 20 districts in Uttar Pradesh, 19 in Tamil Nadu, 11 in Maharashtra, and nine in Karnataka

title: Somnath is symbol of ‘civilisational courage’, says PM Modi
content: Starting his three-day visit to Gujarat, PM Modi witnessed a drone show and presided over a meeting of the Shree Somnath Trust as its chairman

title: Naidu vows to bring world’s top universities to Amaravati
content: Chief Minister says capital already hosts reputed private universities, highlights focus on quantum, AI and higher education growth at Siddhartha Academy golden jubilee celebrations

title: Self-reliance in defence is crucial for India’s strategic autonomy: Defence Secretary
content: ‘Evolving global supply chains and rapidly advancing technologies present both challenges and unprecedented opportunities for India’s defence sector,’ says Rajesh Kumar Singh

title: Congress launches 45-day ‘MGNREGA Bachao Sangram’ against new rural jobs legislation
content: The campaign seeks the restoration of MGNREGA in its original form as a rights-based legislation guaranteeing employment, strengthening the role of panchayats, and ensuring accountability

title: China will have half of newly-diagnosed Parkinson’s disease cases in the next decade: Nobel Laureate
content: In 2030, it is estimated that 8.7 million individuals will be affected by Parkinson’s, of which 57% will be from China, 14% from Europe, 8% from India, 7% from the U.S., 4% from Brazil, and 10% others

title: At pre-Budget meet, Thangam Thennarasu flags GST losses, seeks release of pending dues
content: He also urges the Centre to reconsider the Metro Rail proposals for Madurai and Coimbatore, saying that the grounds cited for their rejection were inconsistent with those cited for the approval granted to the projects in other cities

title: AAP holds protests in Punjab against circulation of Atishi's 'doctored' video
content: An FIR has been registered in the matter, and a forensic examination ‘confirmed deliberate manipulation’ of the clip, the party says

title: Eminent citizens being harassed during SIR, Mamata writes again to CEC
content: It is a matter of profound shame that Nobel Laureate Prof. Amartya Sen-a nonagenarian and a globally respected intellectual, has been asked to appear before ECI officials to establish his credentials, Ms . Banerjee wrote in the letter

title: Eighth airport of Andhra Pradesh to come up at Dagadarthi
content: Request for Proposal has been issued to invite private participation for development, operation, and maintenance under a long-term concession framework

title: Elderly people share slew of concerns as govt. panel seeks to set priorities
content: Over 150 people representing senior citizen forums and voluntary organisations put together their concerns and suggestions at a hearing held by the Kerala State Elderly Commission

title: Police foil Somasila visit, place YSRCP leaders under house arrest
content: Kakani Govardhan Reddy accuses CM N. Chandrababu Naidu of secret Telangana pact over scrapped Rayalaseema irrigation scheme

title: UDF, BJP campaign against Left over Sabarimala lost its relevance, says CPI
content: The party said the State government has fully cooperated with the investigation; those who tried to steal the wealth of the temple should be treated as culprits

title: Consider Romeo-Juliet clause in POCSO to protect adolescent relationships, Supreme Court tells Centre
content: Abuse of POCSO, especially by families objecting to romantic involvement among teenagers, has become common, says court; orders the judgment copy to be given to Law Secretary to take steps to ‘curb this menace’

title: SIT conducts protracted search and seizure operation at Sabarimala senior Tantri’s private residence in Chengannur
content: Officials say the SIT reportedly focussed on creating an inventory of artefacts, including gold ornaments, in Rajeevaru’s possession to audit their provenance and confiscate the objects, including bank statements and legal documents, pertaining to the case

title: A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan urges doctors to visit tribal pockets once a month
content: Pawan performs bhumi puja for construction of buildings and labs at Rangaraya Medical College and lauds alumni for raising  ₹11.10 crore for the purpose

title: Union Budget 2026-27: Kerala’s wish-list includes ‘Special Fiscal Correction Package,’ defence innovation corridor, revenue protection measures under GST
content: State reiterates demand for AIIMS, Sabari Rail, special package for return migrants and aid for paddy and rubber sectors

title: Stafford, Garrett, Nacua top NFL All-Pro Team
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett, Puka Nacua and Jaxon Smith-Njigba headline the 2025 Associated Press NFL All-Pro Team.

title: IU, 'chip on our shoulder,' adds to CFP dominance
content: Undefeated Indiana's already-impressive march through the College Football Playoff continued with a 56-22 win over Oregon in the Peach Bowl semifinal.

title: 'Really poor finish': Early turnovers stymie Ducks
content: Oregon sustained a second straight ugly exit from the College Football Playoff, giving up three first-half turnovers in a 56-22 loss to Indiana.

title: Macclesfield beats champ Palace in FA Cup shock
content: Non-league Macclesfield pulled off one of the biggest-ever FA Cup upsets as they knocked out holders Crystal Palace in a remarkable 2-1 win at the third-round stage.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Giannis gets block, steal on LeBron, plus his jersey
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo helped seal Milwaukee's 105-101 victory against the Lakers with a pair of clutch defensive plays down the stretch against LeBron James.

title: Vonn zooms to 2nd downhill victory before Milan
content: Lindsey Vonn won her second World Cup downhill in four races this season, raising expectations in this remarkable comeback at age 41 ahead of the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Six NFL wild-card games, six matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Packers at Bears. Bryce Young's first playoff game. Justin Herbert vs. Drake Maye. We have picks, stats to know and more for every wild-card game.

title: FA Cup third-round upsets: Macclesfield, Wrexham giant killers
content: It's a notoriously tricky time for big clubs against lower-league opposition and this year is proving no exception.

title: 'Not sure why they felt the need': NBA execs on the Trae deal and trade season's next move
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Men's: A weak nonconference slate could doom Georgia
content: The Bulldogs are a few SEC losses away from the wrong side of the bubble due to a number of low-quality wins.

title: Women's: Why LSU's seed could be determined in the next two games
content: LSU has work to do after its 0-2 start in SEC play, but opportunity arrives with the season's most crucial two-game stretch.

title: Predicting conference winners -- and their biggest threats
content: The ACC and Big East feature clear favorites, but competition is tighter in the Big Ten, Big 12 and SEC.

title: Jaguars' all teal, Panthers' all black lead NFL wild-card weekend uniforms
content: The NFL's wild-card round kicks off Saturday with multiple teams opting for traditional uniform combinations.

title: The inside story of the Bears' 'Good, better, best!' craze
content: After each win, Ben Johnson leads the Bears in a chant they hope to keep alive after Saturday night's game vs. the Packers.

title: Supercopa Clasico preview, predictions: Are Barcelona favorites vs. Real Madrid?
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid meet in the Supercopa final on Sunday, but who has the upper hand? Sam Marsden and Alex Kirkland preview the upcoming Clasico.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal want Newcastle's Livramento
content: Arsenal have their eye on Newcastle's Tino Livramento, and Ousmane Dembélé is going to reject a new PSG contract. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: From future HOF pitchers to a veteran catcher: Best fits for under-the-radar MLB free agents
content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: 'We're all using it as motivation': LSU aims to shake off last season and win again
content: Last year, the defending champion Tigers were edged out of finals. Now they're back -- with a plan to win the national title again.

title: NFL wild-card round: Expect a tight game between 49ers and Eagles
content: Odds, game picks, prop plays, betting advice and daily fantasy tips for the 49ers-Eagles wild-card matchup.

title: The 2026 championship parlays: From conservative plays to huge potential payouts
content: We go on record picking this year's champions, beginning with the CFP and ending with the World Series.

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams: Key free agents, draft outlook, priorities and predictions
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 18 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Inside Washington's quiet collapse in 2025 and the decisions defining its offseason
content: Parting ways with Kliff Kingsbury was a bold move that raised the stakes for Dan Quinn & Co. this offseason.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's Olympic players
content: The Lightning are up to No. 2 -- and are tops in players on Olympic rosters. Here's who each team will send.

title: Balan refuses to apologise to Jamaat-e-Islami
content: Jamaat-e-Islami had sent the senior CPI(M) leader a legal notice against defamatory remarks, seeking an apology and ₹1 crore in compensation

title: Centre should share surcharge collections with States: Bhatti
content: Mr. Bhatti Vikramarka made a strong pitch for enhanced fiscal space for States, greater devolution of resources and early sanction of major infrastructure projects

title: Manipur fuel outlets shut down demanding security after bomb attacks
content: In a letter to Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla, the State’s petroleum dealers said they have been facing severe threats despite steps taken for their safety

title: Palliative care needs to be integrated into dentistry, says M.R. Rajagopal
content: Pallium India has launched a new Department of Palliative Care Dentistry in Thiruvananthapuram, aimed at addressing the often-overlooked oral health challenges faced by head and neck cancer survivors.

title: CWC orders probe into allegation of teacher’s sexual abuse of students
content: The police arrested the teacher after he allegedly abused a Class VI student at his quarters, reportedly after giving the child liquor

title: ONGC completes capping of Mori-5 well in Konaseema in five days
content: A major blowout of natural gas was reported in Mori-5 well during workover activity aimed at increasing the flow of the natural gas on January 5

title: One dead, six hospitalised after inhaling carbon monoxide in Dharwad
content: The incident came to light after their colleague visited their room to check after repeated calls went unanswered

title: Arrangements in place for Makaravilakku festival
content: Virtual Queue bookings capped at 35,000 for January 13 and 30,000 for January 14, the festival day. Only those with valid Virtual Queue bookings will be allowed darshan, say police. As part of traffic management, restrictions will be imposed on pilgrims’ movement

title: ISRO’s Aditya-L1 decodes how solar storms impact Earth’s magnetic field
content: The study used observations from Aditya-L1, India’s first solar observatory, along with data from other international space missions to decode the impact of a massive eruption of solar plasma from the Sun

title: CPI(M), Congress, and BJP draw battle lines over Sabarimala theft, Jamaat-e-Islami Hind, and religious fundamentalism
content: CPI(M) will launch mass movement against schismatic politics, BJP will observe Makaravilakku season as faith protection month, while Congress will spotlight LDF’s ‘rightward drift to Hindutva politics’

title: Quack arrested in Tirupattur
content: A special medical team conducted a surprise check in the house after health officials got complaints from residents

title: NH-65 under drone surveillance as Sankranti traffic from Hyderabad peaks
content: Panthangi Toll Plaza, which typically handles between 15,000 and 20,000 vehicles a day, is seeing a a fourfold rise in traffic as festive travel surges

title: Recon Expo 2026 receives a good response
content: Recon Expo 2026, projected as North Karnataka’s largest interior design and construction materials exhibition, which began in Hubballi on Friday and witnessed a higher visitor turnout on Saturday.

title: RPF seize 21 kg ganja at Jolarpet railway station
content: The team searched coaches of the express train where they found two abandoned tourist bags in the luggage carrier of the general compartment

title: India should design and manufacture 70% of products made here over the next 10 years, say experts
content: IIT professors, research leaders call for support to Indian students and scientists to convert their ideas into successful commercial products at webinar organised by SASTRA, The Hindu Education Plus

title: Blast at fireworks factory in Bengal’s Champahati leaves four severely injured
content: Local police and firefighters reached the spot and doused the flames, rescued the locals, and started investigating the cause of the fire; the blast site was sealed off to secure the location.

title: Minister Duraimurugan distributes free laptops for students at Katpadi
content: Tiruvannamalai has the highest number of 5,102 beneficiaries, followed by Vellore, Ranipet, and Tirupattur

title: Complaint against seven employees of ICFRE–IWST for securing govt. jobs through forgery and impersonation
content: During internal scrutiny at the IWST, discrepancies were noticed between the handwriting, signatures, attendance sheets, OMR answer sheets, admit cards and service records of the accused employees

title: Lack of port-driven industrial ecosystem deprives Kerala from tapping Vizhinjam’s potential
content: The seaport has once again emerged as the top-performing port on the east and south coasts of India, registering a container throughput of 1.21 lakh twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) in December 2025

title: CREDAI property show sees rising footfalls on Day 2 in Vijayawada
content: About 2,000 visitors have attended the three-day event so far as organisers expect turnout to reach 5,000 by the final day amid cautious optimism in the real estate sector

title: Chandrababu Naidu calls for action plan to highlight benefits of VB-G RAM G scheme
content: Its aim is not only to provide employment to the poor but also create assets in the villages, says the Chief Minister, adding that the scheme has been devised to create an additional 25 days of employment to the poor

title: Woman devotee robbed of gold Talibottu at Tirumala
content: The accused administered a sedative tablet to the woman inside Vaikuntha Queue Complex and fled with the jewellery when the latter fell unconscious

title: APPCB Chairman cautions public against burning hazardous waste in bonfires
content: Burning of Bhogi bonfires and waste leads to increased air pollution, further deteriorating air quality, explains P. Krishnayya

title: Jagan should study the way civilisations flourished along rivers in the world, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The YSRCP chief does not even know the difference between a river bed and river basin, but continues his vicious propaganda against Amaravati, says the Chief Minister

title: Calicut Half Marathon to be held on February 8
content: The 2026 edition will be conducted under the theme ‘Run to Remember – Alzheimer’s and Dementia Awareness’

title: Tracing traffic violations: Road deaths fall for second straight year in Bengaluru despite rise in accidents
content: Karthik Reddy, Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic), attributes the improvement to better enforcement and special drives such as drunk-driving checks, which led to a reduction in accidents

title: 11 arrested in two cases, 4.4 kg of ganja seized in Guntur
content: The Guntur police have registered 46 NDPS cases, arrested 217 persons and seized 78 kg of ganja, liquid ganja and MDMA in the past three months, says SP

title: IND vs NZ: Rishabh Pant ruled out of ODI series due to side strain injury
content: "He has been diagnosed with a right-sided strain with internal oblique muscle tear, and has thus been ruled out of the forthcoming ODI series against New Zealand," a reliable source told TOI. While KL Rahul is the regular wicketkeeper in India's ODI side, the selectors will soon announce a replacement for Pant.

title: China to Meta: We need to be sure that you have not broken any Chinese law on ...
content: Meta's acquisition of AI startup Manus, with Chinese roots, is under investigation by China for potential violations of technology export and outbound investment laws.  Despite Manus's move to Singapore and Meta's clarification on no continuing Chinese ownership, Beijing is scrutinizing the deal, citing the company's founding and parentage.

title: 'If he is fit': Not Bumrah or Hardik - Ganguly names India’s X-factor for T20 World Cup
content: India have named a spin-heavy bowling group for the next month's T20 World Cup, including Chakravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel and Washington Sundar. Ganguly said the spin options give India an edge in home conditions.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page 'cutting ties' with America's Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: 'Jai Somnath': PM Modi marks 1000 yrs since first attack on temple - watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commenced a three-day visit to Gujarat, beginning in Somnath to participate in the Somnath Swabhiman Parv. His itinerary includes attending the Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference and holding talks with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz. The visit also features a drone show, a ceremonial procession, and the inauguration of several development projects.

title: WPL: Comeback win! Harmanpreet's Mumbai thrash Jemimah's Delhi
content: Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals by 50 runs in the WPL with a dominant all-round display. Nat Sciver-Brunt (70 not out) and Harmanpreet Kaur (74 not out) powered MI to 195/4. Delhi’s chase faltered early as Nicola Carey struck key blows, and despite Chinelle Henry’s 56, DC were bowled out for 145 in 19 overs.

title: Amazon to H-1B employees working in India: You can't code or sign; full list of dont's
content: Amazon is allowing employees stranded in India due to H-1B visa delays to work remotely until March 2. However, strict restrictions prevent them from coding, making strategic decisions, or interacting with customers. These limitations, reportedly due to local laws, significantly hinder core job functions, leaving many engineers questioning their productivity.

title: '77 deaths due to SIR': Mamata makes shock claim; attacks EC again
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has strongly condemned the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in the state, alleging it has led to 77 deaths and numerous hospitalizations. She criticized the Election Commission of India (ECI) for a "relentlessly harassing" and "unplanned" process that lacks human judgment and social sensitivity, particularly impacting women voters and prominent citizens.

title: WPL: Meg Lanning goes past Ellyse Perry in this list; closes in on Sciver-Brunt
content: Phoebe Litchfield’s aggressive 78 off 40 balls could not prevent UP Warriorz from going down as Gujarat Giants registered a 10-run win in a high-scoring Women’s Premier League (WPL) match.​​

title: Syria clashes: Security forces deploy in Aleppo; dozens killed in fighting
content: Syrian security forces deployed in Aleppo's Sheikh Maqsoud after days of clashes with Kurdish fighters, which resulted in dozens of casualties and displacement. An explosive drone later struck a government building, with state TV blaming Kurdish forces, a claim they deny. Military operations have reportedly halted, with Kurdish fighters being transferred out of the area.

title: Indian Railways timetable: 549 trains sped up, 122 new added; what TAG 2026 means for passengers
content: Indian Railways introduces a major timetable change, TAG 2026. This plan adds 122 new trains and speeds up 549 existing services across the country. The goal is to reduce travel times and improve punctuality. New Vande Bharat and Amrit Bharat trains are part of this expansion.

title: Hyderabad shocker: Woman poisons 11-month-old son before suicide; faced marital disputes
content: A 27-year-old woman in Hyderabad allegedly poisoned her 11-month-old son before dying by suicide due to marital disputes. The woman's mother discovered the tragedy and attempted suicide, now receiving medical treatment. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Warning sent! Sooryavanshi's carnage turns heads - watch
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi dazzled in India U19’s World Cup warm-up against Scotland, smashing 96 off 50 balls to power India to 374/8. Opening the innings, the left-hander mixed precision with power, striking nine fours and seven sixes. His fearless, fluent knock and rapid partnership with Aaron George sent a clear warning to rivals.

title: US mass shooting: Six shot dead in Mississippi; suspect in custody
content: Six people were killed in a series of related shootings across three locations in West Point, Mississippi. Authorities have taken a suspect into custody, confirming they no longer pose a threat to the community. Investigations are ongoing, with further details expected to be released.

title: Prince of Persia: Why some Iranians are clamouring for Reza Pahalvi's return
content: Reza Pahlavi was born into a future designed around continuity. Born in Tehran in 1960, he was raised as heir to the Peacock Throne, educated by private tutors, and trained for a role that assumed permanence. The monarchy was not merely a form of government. It was the organising principle of the state.

title: Compared with Akhtar, KKR’s pacer omitted from J&K Ranji camp
content: Indian pacer Umran Malik, nicknamed the “Indian Shoaib Akhtar,” has been left out of Jammu and Kashmir’s Ranji Trophy preparatory camp due to poor domestic form. Despite international experience, he played only one Ranji match without success and was earlier dropped from the Vijay Hazare squad. Opener Qamran Iqbal was also omitted as J&K prepare for phase two.

title: 'Don't make bad decision': Days after ICE kills woman, agent threatens people sitting in car
content: Minneapolis women were filmed taunting ICE agents days after a protester's fatal shooting. Footage shows agents warning the women against interference, with one responding defiantly. The incident occurred amid controversy over the shooting of Renee Nicole Good, with differing accounts from ICE and local officials.

title: Ludhiana horror: Man cuts friend’s body into 6 pieces after consuming ‘chitta’; CCTV shows couple carrying body
content: A shocking murder in Ludhiana saw a carpenter allegedly dismember his friend's body after a drug-fueled argument over debt. CCTV footage captured the gruesome disposal of the remains hidden in a drum, with his wife reportedly aiding the cleanup. Police have arrested the couple as the investigation into the brutal crime continues.

title: Trump's 500% tariff & crude shock: Where does India's oil security stand?
content: Amidst Trump's 500% tariff threat, it's important to note that despite heavy import dependence, India’s energy security has strengthened through diversified crude sourcing and greater refining flexibility, improving resilience to external supply shocks.

title: Kashmiri man detained at Ram Mandir: 'Attempted' to offer namaz; family claims mental illness
content: A 55-year-old man from Jammu and Kashmir was detained in Ayodhya after allegedly attempting to offer namaz inside the Ram Mandir complex. Security personnel intervened, and the man was handed over to police. His family claims he is mentally ill and has a history of leaving home without notice. Investigations are ongoing to determine his intent.

title: ‘Pal me tola pal mei masha’: BJP slams oppn over SIR flips, calls it ‘Yaksha parashna’
content: The BJP attacked the INDIA bloc over electoral roll revisions, accusing opposition parties of shifting stances and turning a constitutional exercise into a spectacle. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav questioned the Election Commission's neutrality, alleging BJP leaders had advance knowledge of voter deletions in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Trump reads Rubio’s note during oil executives’ meeting — what was written in it?
content: During a White House press conference, President Trump unexpectedly read a private handwritten note from Secretary of State Marco Rubio aloud. The note, instructing Trump to "Go back to Chevron," caused visible discomfort for Rubio and amusement for Vice President Vance.

title: Major change! Neeraj Chopra parts ways with coach; breached 90-m mark under him
content: Olympic star Neeraj Chopra has ended his coaching partnership with javelin legend Jan Zelezny after a successful year. Chopra credited Zelezny for helping him surpass the 90-meter mark and expressed admiration for his idol. Both athletes highlighted their positive relationship and plan to stay in touch. Chopra now aims for greater control over his training as he targets future championships.

title: 'Exposing my identity': Unnao rape survivor pleads for help; blames Sengar's daughters
content: The Unnao rape survivor has appealed for support. She claims Kuldeep Singh Sengar's daughters and their supporters are revealing her identity on social media. This puts her safety at risk. The Supreme Court has stayed a High Court order granting bail to Sengar. The survivor's mother welcomed the Supreme Court's decision.

title: Oil not well: Why ExxonMobil thinks Venezuela is 'uninvestable'
content: This collapse is central to the scepticism voiced by oil companies. Restoring production on a meaningful scale is not a matter of restarting wells. It would require rebuilding pipelines, upgraders, refineries, power supply and skilled manpower, all of which demand long-term capital commitments.

title: IND vs NZ: Injury scare for India before first ODI; star batter leaves field in pain
content: Pant was batting against Indian throwdown specialists when he copped the blow and was seen grimacing in pain.

title: Meerut Dalit woman murder: Main killer arrested in Haridwar; cops confirm safe recovery of daughter
content: Police apprehended the alleged killer of a Dalit woman in Haridwar two days after her murder and her daughter's abduction in Meerut. The daughter was safely recovered. Political leaders attempting to visit the aggrieved family were reportedly stopped by security forces, while BJP politicians were allowed access.

title: Watch: Drunk Bengaluru techie jumps divider crashes into wall of Barbeque Nation
content: A software engineer, driving under the influence of alcohol, narrowly missed causing a major tragedy in Bengaluru. He lost control of his car, jumped a road median on Indiranagar's 100 Feet Road, and crashed into a restaurant wall. Fortunately, pedestrians and other vehicles escaped unharmed, though two vehicles were damaged.

title: Pakistan pacer's action questioned in BBL! Warner warns umpires - watch
content: Pakistan pacer Zaman Khan came under scrutiny in the Big Bash League after David Warner questioned his slingshot bowling action during a match. Warner raised concerns with umpires after scoring 82. Zaman struggled in his debut for Brisbane Heat, conceding 32 runs, though Heat won comfortably. The incident revived memories of Muhammad Hasnain’s past action controversy.

title: Ukrainian drone strike hits oil depot in Russia’s Volgograd; Moscow steps up attacks
content: A Ukrainian drone strike ignited a fire at a Russian oil depot in Volgograd on Saturday, with no immediate reports of casualties. This incident follows a large-scale Russian attack on Ukraine, which included the use of a hypersonic missile. Both nations continue to target energy infrastructure amidst escalating conflict.

title: Dhurandhar box office day 37: Ranveer Singh film nears Rs 800 crore
content: Dhurandhar earned Rs 3.4 crore on its sixth Friday, potentially impacted by The Raja Saab's release. While Stree 2 saw more on its equivalent day due to cinema day, Dhurandhar's weekend might outperform it. The Raja Saab could experience a weekend drop due to mixed reviews and word-of-mouth.

title: Broad daylight murder in Delhi: Woman shot in head; cops probe link to 2023 husband’s killing
content: Rachna Yadav, president of Shalimar Bagh's RWA, was shot dead in broad daylight. The incident, occurring around 11 am, is believed to be linked to the murder of her husband in Bhalswa village last year. Police are investigating the case as murder, with personal rivalry and old enmity as primary lines of inquiry.

title: Garbage avalanche: Death toll rises in Philippines landfill collapse; 34 feared trapped
content: A devastating landfill collapse in the Philippines has claimed at least four lives, with dozens still missing. Rescue efforts are underway in Cebu city, where workers are feared trapped beneath tons of debris. Authorities are investigating ground instability and heavy rainfall as potential causes for the disaster, which has evoked memories of a similar tragedy.

title: 'Technical snag detected': Small aircraft crashes near Odisha's airstrip; pilot sustains injuries
content: A small aircraft executed an emergency belly landing approximately nine kilometers from Rourkela airstrip due to a mid-flight technical fault. While all passengers emerged safely, the pilot sustained serious injuries and was transported to a hospital for medical attention. The pilot's quick thinking in spotting an open grassland prevented further casualties.

title: T20 World Cup snub: Gill turns to 'destiny'; responds to exclusion from squad
content: The 26-year-old was not picked for the T20 World Cup despite leading India in the longer formats. Gill has played 36 T20Is, scoring 869 runs at an average of 28.03 and a strike rate of 138.59. He was dropped from the T20 setup after managing 291 runs in his last 15 matches in the format at an average of 24.25.

title: Lured With Jobs, Forced To Work For Scamsters In Myanmar, 27 Indians Rescued
content: For weeks, all that several families across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana had to go on were fragments of information exchanged over brief phone calls, and the knowledge that their sons were somewhere across the border in Myanmar.

title: Blog: Blog | Parasakthi Delivers A Fiery Political Statement
content: Parasakthi. The Supreme Power. Sivaji Ganesan's Parasakthi in 1952 showcased Dravidian ideology and created a cultural movement in Tamil Nadu.

title: Greenland Parliament To Bring Forward Meeting To Discuss US Threats
content: Greenland's parliament will bring forward a meeting to discuss its response to US threats to take control of the Arctic island, the leaders of the five political parties in the Greenlandic assembly said in a joint statement.

title: 4 Oil Tankers That Left Venezuela In 'Dark Mode' Back In Its Waters
content: At least four tankers, most of them loaded, that had departed from Venezuela in early January in 'dark mode' - or with their transponders off amid a strict US blockade - are now back in the South American country's waters

title: Shady Loans, 'Missing' Rs 9-Crore Bentley: Businessman Arrested For Fraud
content: A businessman who allegedly scammed investors by routing their money through a complex web of transactions and buying luxury cars, including a Bentley Bentayga that he claimed cost Rs 9 crore, has been arrested by the Delhi Police.

title: Lashkar No. 2 Makes Speech At Pak School, Boasts Of Army Links
content: The Pakistan-based terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba's second most important figure, Saifullah Kasuri, has admitted the terror organisation's link with the Pakistani military.

title: PM Modi Chants Mantras As Somnath Temple Marks 1,000 Years Since 1st Attack
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday reached Somnath as part of his three-day Gujarat visit, during which he will participate in several events including the 'Somnath Swabhiman Parv' and Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference.

title: Protesters Are 'Enemies Of God': Iran Warns Of Death Penalty In Crackdown
content: Amid two weeks of mass protests, Iran's attorney general, Mohammad Movahedi Azad, has warned that anyone participating in demonstrations will be considered an "enemy of God", a charge that comes with the death penalty under Iranian law.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Political Potency Of 'Parasakthi': Box Office, Ballot Box, And Beyond
content: Parasakthi is not merely a film set against history; it is history weaponised for the present. From its very first frame, the movie announces its political intent, rooting itself firmly in the anti-Hindi imposition agitations of the 1950s and 60s.

title: 6 Killed In Mass Shooting In US State Of Mississippi, Suspect Arrested
content: At least six people were fatally shot on Friday night in Clay County, Mississippi, and the suspect is in custody.

title: Fuel Stations In Manipur's Valley Areas Shut After Bomb Attack, Extortion Threats
content: Two days after a bomb attack at a fuel station in Bishnupur district, the Manipur Petroleum Dealers Fraternity (MPDF) announced an indefinite closure of all petrol pumps in the "valley area and its peripherals".

title: Indonesia Suspends Elon Musk's Grok AI Over Pornographic Content
content: Indonesia suspended Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok on Saturday over concerns about AI-generated pornographic content, the country's communication and digital affairs minister said.

title: Lawyers Protest, Stage Hunger Strike Over Gauhati High Court Relocation
content: Lawyers from the Gauhati High Court are at odds with the Assam government over the proposed relocation of the court.

title: 'Willing To Back Even Trump For Strong Maharashtra': Raj Thackeray To NDTV
content: Flexibility in political approach does not mean a compromise on ideology, MNS chief Raj Thackeray has said, adding he would be willing to back even US President Donald Trump if that meant ensuring Maharashtra remained strong.

title: Woman, 67, Arrested For Supplying Arms To Gangsters In Delhi: Cops
content: A 67-year-old woman was arrested for alleged involvement in an organised illegal firearms trafficking syndicate that supplied weapons to gangsters and dreaded criminals operating in Delhi-NCR, an official said on Saturday.

title: US Will 'Seek Wars' Till Its Economy Depends On Oil: Colombian President
content: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said that the US will continue to seek wars as long as their economy depends on oil and coal. In his remark, he also added that if the US had not pulled out of the Paris Agreement, "there would be no wars".

title: Scamsters Use AI To Clone Cousin's Voice, Dupe Indore Teacher Of Rs 1 lakh
content: It sounded exactly like her cousin. The tone, the urgency, even the familiar way he spoke. But the voice on the phone was not her cousin's, it was generated using artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Probe Agency ED Approaches Supreme Court In Showdown With Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal government officials with support of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stopped Enforcement Directorate (ED) officials from carrying out searches and seizing material linked to the ED's investigation into an alleged coal smuggling scam.

title: 8 Arrested In Gujarat For Raping 15-Year-Old Girl: Cops
content: Eight persons were arrested in Gujarat's Navsari district for allegedly gangraping a 15-year-old girl, a police official said on Saturday.

title: Meet Noor Ahmad Noor, Afghanistan's 1st Envoy In India Since Taliban Takeover
content: Afghanistan has appointed Noor Ahmad Noor as its Charge d'Affaires to the Afghan Embassy in New Delhi, nearly five years after the Taliban took control of Kabul in 2021.

title: What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: the NHL hasn't sent players to the ice hockey arena in 12 years due to a myriad of issues . many of those issues were addressed in an agreement the NHL and NHLPA signed with the IIHF and IOC in July . the arena wasn't close to being finished, and the NHL doesn't have the correct dimensions .

title: Ja Morant trade guide: Four proposals for Memphis -- if it can find a suitor
content: sources tell ESPN's Shams Charania that a trade would end the franchise's tumultuous seven-year tenure in Memphis . the 26-year-old is averaging career lows in minutes, rebounds and 2- and 3-point percentages . he was suspended earlier this season for conduct detrimental to the team .

title: Premier League midseason awards: Best player, manager, more
content: the premier league is now 21 games in -- just a bit past the exact halfway of the 38-game season . most of the awards are determined by statistics: Golden Boot, Playmaker of the Year, Golden Glove . there are four other "major" awards that are fun to think about .

title: NFL's best QB room? How Mac Jones and Brock Purdy helped each other to the playoffs
content: quarterback Brock Purdy was preparing for the 49ers' playoff matchup against the Eagles . he'd reclaim the role as long as he was healthy enough to play near the standard he set on his way to landing a $265 million contract in may .

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: the WNBA CBA is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m. ET on friday . the league and its players union will likely enter into a stage of "status quo" a work stoppage or lockout can be declared without notice . sources say negotiations have netted minimal progress .

title: Is Jordan Love on the same SB path as Favre, Rodgers?
content: the transition from Favre to Rodgers has been compared and dissected since the Packers drafted Love no. 26 in 2020 . he says he's been a super bowl-winning, three-time MVP quarterback . love has been in the same sweet spot as his predecessors, he writes .

title: What Bryce Young's late-game magic means for Panthers' postseason: 'Nothing really fazes him'
content: quarterback Bryce Young is consistent in everything he does before and after games . coach Dave canales almost laughed on Thursday when asked if he had done anything out of the ordinary . he's the first player in the 2023 draft to make his first playoff appearance since 2017 .

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: 'That's what that $4 million is all about': Behind Beck, Miami delivers a drive for the ages
content: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips rocked nervously on the sideline . the canes now have one final drive to keep their magical playoff run going . he huddled up with his teammates and urged them to keep the faith .

title: How Liam Coen got the Jaguars to the playoffs: 'It makes us want to fight for him'
content: coach Liam Coen previews his team's playoff matchup vs. Josh Allen and the Bills . he delivers an energetic fist pump and an emphatic "How's that feel?" it's a phrase his father, Tim, used after victories as a college and high school coach in Rhode Island . players and coaches love it, too .

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: CFP semifinal takeaways: Utter dominance has become the norm for Indiana
content: Texas, Penn State and Clemson were among the preseason national title favorites . the hoosiers and Hurricanes will play in the CFP national championship on Jan. 19 in the Hard Rock Stadium . they will play for their first title since 2001 .

title: Inside the day the Ravens moved on from Harbaugh, and what's next for Baltimore
content: it seems no one inside the Baltimore Ravens ' training facility had conviction that Tuesday would become the most shocking day in franchise history . the belief inside the building was that the Ravens would undergo staff changes, perhaps at the coordinator positions, but that Harbaugh would remain the head coach in 2026 .

title: Iraq, Iran, Venezuela ...: Wars without declarations - the American way
content: The United States military is the strongest and most fearsome military on the planet, by far, with capabilities and skills our enemies can scarcely begin to imagine. The proliferation of codified jus in bello—the law of war governing belligerent conduct—has created disincentives for states to issue formal declarations. The approach of using drones, small numbers of special forces, and cyber warfare—rather than deploying large numbers of troops—does not inflict casualties on American forces that would draw public attention, thereby removing a key barrier to war.

title: ‘Suspicious’ pigeon caught in forward village along LoC
content:
.

JAMMU: A suspicious pigeon, believed to be from Pakistan, was caught in a forward village near the LoC in Akhnoor sector of J&K on Saturday. The pigeon, caught in Kharah Balli village, was bearing coded markings, police said. The bird was first noticed by a 13-year-old boy, whose parents informed the police. “The pale grey pigeon is having red and yellow rings in legs inscribed with “Rehmat Sarkar” along with a mobile number and a name, followed by certain numbers, besides stamped wings,” police sources said. Additionally, a stamp was observed on the wings mentioning “Nowshera Aling Pigeon Club”, they said. Meanwhile, locals of Gorkha Nagar on Saturday noticed an object suspected to be a drone lying near a nallah in the area. Police have taken the object in custody for a detailed examination.

End of Article

title: Arms consignment dropped by Pakistan drone recovered from Samba village
content: a packet containing one Chinese HE grenade, 16 rounds of 9mm cartridges, one Glock pistol with a magazine, and one Star pistol with two magazines was recovered from the site . the recovery was made amid heightened security measures to thwart any attempt by terrorists to disrupt the upcoming Republic Day celebrations .
